# enemy

enemy ≈ un¬amigo ≈ inimīcus <> anemigu ≈ nemìg ≈ anmik

󳇕 󳇖 󳇗 󳇘 󳇙 󳇚 󳇛 󳇜 󳇝 󳇞 󳇟 󳇠 󳇡 󳇢 󳇣 󳇤 󳇥 󳇦 󳇧 󳇨 󳇩 󳇪 󳇫

𓐍 𓂋 𓅱 𓀒 𓀐 | enemy | 𓐍 𓏏 𓆑 𓀀 critic κριτικός ≈ judged @ court 𓐍 𓂋 𓅱 𓀒 𓀐 | enemy | criminal 𒉽𒎌 kur₂mes @ guerre 𓐍 𓂋 𓅱 𓀒 𓀐 | enemy | 𐎌𐎗𐎗 šrr "enemy" شَرّ šarr “true evil” शत्रुः (śatruḥ): enemy 𓐍 𓂋 𓅱 𓀒 𓀐 | enemy | @ 𓐍 𓂋 𓅱 𓀒 𓈇 𓏤 𓏪 | low-lying land | 𓌨 <> foreigner

𓌨 ϧⲁⲣⲟ⳼ ϧⲁⲧⲁⲣ⳼ 𓐍 𓏏 𓆑 𓀀 𒁽 gir₅ queer "strange" in 𒉆 𒁽 nam-gir₅ ˢʸnamgir status as stranger 𒉽 kur₂ 𒄥 gur queer "strange" 𒉽 KURD stranger 𒉽𒎌 kur₂mes <> krumm 𓀡 ξένο /•creno/ 𒂵𒊑 ga-ri גֵּר ger stranger, foreigner 𒄘𒉈𒊒 gu₂erim₂ √guerre hostile, enemy 𒇽𒉽𒉽𒊏 lu₂kur₂kur₂ra kurkura 𓇥 𓂋 𓇥 𓂋 𓅱 𓀢 𓏥 𓀀 stranger 𒇽𒉽 lu₂kur₂ stranger 𒂵𒊑 ga-ri guerry ≠ garrison "enemies" 𒂵𒊑𒅀 ga-re-ia gareia™ "enemy" 𒂵𒊑𒅀 gatrivia :

𓐍 𓏏 𓆑 ceteri : other "4th" outside of biblical trinity?
